attributes.action: Give the public the power to trigger a no confidence vote in the Government
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, only MPs can trigger a vote of no confidence. We believe this power should also be available to the people, especially in times of widespread dissatisfaction. A defined legal process would ensure this power is democratic, orderly, and used responsibly.

This reform would strengthen public accountability and restore trust in our democratic system.
attributes.background: We call on Parliament to introduce legislation allowing UK citizens to trigger a public vote of no confidence in the Government. If a set number of verified signatures is reached, the law would require a binding national vote on whether the Government should stay in office.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/702341
